title: Understanding Gibbs Free Energy
text: The Gibbs free energy change (ΔG) for a process can be calculated using the formula: ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - TΔS, where ΔH is the enthalpy change, T is the temperature in kelvin, and ΔS is the entropy change.

title: Calculate ΔG for Benzene
text: In this problem, you're asked to calculate the Gibbs free energy change (ΔG) for melting $$1$$ mol of benzene at $$279$$ K using the given values for ΔH and ΔS. What values do we substitute into the equation ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - TΔS?

title: Substitute the Values
text: Given the enthalpy of fusion for benzene as $$9.87$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ and the entropy of fusion as $$35.7$$ J/(K∙mol), convert ΔH into the same unit as ΔS before substituting them into the equation.

title: Calculate ΔG
text: Now substitute the values into the equation ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - TΔS. Remember to use the given temperature, $$279$$ K.

title: Final Calculation
text: Calculate the value of ΔG after substituting the values.
